message_1: Find the limit of the function f(x) = (3x-1)/(x+2) as x approaches 4.
message_2:
To find the limit of the function f(x) = (3x-1)/(x+2) as x approaches 4, we can simply substitute the value of x with 4 in the function:

f(4) = (3(4) - 1) / (4 + 2)

f(4) = (12 - 1) / (6)

f(4) = 11 / 6

So, the limit of the function f(x) = (3x-1)/(x+2) as x approaches 4 is 11/6.
